description: Danforth Street is more commonly known as "The Danforth" where it becomes the city's Greek neighborhood.

reviews.title: Not what it used to be...
text: I loved going to Greek town on Danforth for many years.  Recently I was greatly disappointed as it did not feel like Greek town.  I spoke to some of the vendors who were still there and they shared that many businesses left due to extremely high rents.  Sad.

reviews.title: Excellent food
text: Love this neighborhood because there are so many great restaurants : Greek, Ethiopian, Iranian, Japanese.
Very warm and pleasing place

reviews.title: Still nice and great food.
text: Toronto is a world class city now so anything popular has people from all over the world. Danforth Greektown is balanced because it’s spread out well. I would suggest avoiding summer festival crowds but it’s still a great hang out and place to eat most of the time.

reviews.title: wow amazing food
text: We went here for my 60 th birthday and just walked the beat. Really nice people and a nice stroll with amazing restaurants

reviews.title: Stayed very close to here when I went to Toronto
text: There are some great restaurants but in general I found some that were reviewed highly as great really weren't.  This is more a place to go for a quick cheap lunch and don't expect anything more out of it

reviews.title: Vibrant Atmosphere
text: One of Toronto's iconic neighbourhoods, the Danforth is home ot many great restaurants, along side with eclectic boutiques and many kinds of service businesses, groceries, the Danforth Theater and many other things to discover.

reviews.title: Don't let Covid-19 stop you from Pampering you're Nails
text: Metro Nails
1985 Danforth Ave Toronto Ontario
M4C 1J7
Hello friends I wanted to write a review on Metro Nails on Danforth because this company (family business) takes such pride and care of each and every customer who enters their store.

First thing, as I enter I am ALWAYS greeted with a smile by the owner Victor(who always remembers my name and everyone who is a regular ) usually his wife Jenny is always working away at her main desk spoiling one of the customers with their manicure . She never misses a chance to also greet and smile.

I can't help but notice how clean and shiny everything is and how thorough everyone who works there ; sanitizing consistently and making sure everyone is adhering to the new world rules and practices.
Once seated at the designated luxurious leather massage chairs, I sink into my comfort position as my feet enter a refreshing clean bath .

Once one of my favorite Pedicurista/ Helen starts making my toenails look beautiful once again( this is truly a creative gift she possesses) she gently slips on my feet some paper slippers and she escorts me to the manicurist area where she continues to give me excellent customer service. She carries my shoes and coat and lays my personal belongings gently by my side
The service is impeccable and the atmosphere being a corner store is cozy and lots of light shining through the corner windows and even a large TV screen with the latest movie to pass the time.

This is a wonderful neighborhood haunt of mine but anyone who ventures along East Danforth  must make it a point to stop by and get pampered by this truly precious find. Even if you stop in unexpectedly,  Victor always finds time to book you in the same day even when its busy.

Once again friends ,whenever I find a special haunt of mine, I have to share my views and invite you to check it out for yourself.  For those of you who are afraid of these challenging times ,come in and see for yourself and you will be completely reassured of the safety and careful attention to detail this wonderful family  provides the most professional customer service! Victor and his team make it a point to  give us all the utmost security and peace and harmony that we all need  during these troubled times.
I don't know about all of you friends but I feel soo much better when I get pampered especially now and my nails are happy again too!
ENJOY Friends
Sandra

reviews.title: Nothing out of the ordinary
text: We were referred to Danforth by a waitress in a Toronto restaurant. We found the street very ordinary with basic shops and a few Greek restaurants. My nephew did get a good haircut at a walk-in barber shop though. Otherwise, unremarkable.

reviews.title: Yum!
text: Such good food in Greektown. I especially like Messini and Square Boy. More than just Greek food. There's Thai, Japanese, Chinese, Indian and fast food. Very easy to get to. Just get off at any of the following TTC stations and you are there: Pape, Chester or Broadview. Love walking around on a nice summer day.

reviews.title: Checking out a new family neighborhood
text: We were there to visit our son and daughter in law who have an apartment in the neigbhorhood.  We very much liked the neighborhood feel, lots of lovely shops and good restaurants all within walking around distance.

reviews.title: Greektown
text: I enjoyed the Greek Festival but would have preferred to visit there and sit and eat in a restaurant.  The festival has no outdoor places to sit.  It made for a 19,000 step day.  Loved the camaraderie and the festival feel - I think I would have spent less time.

reviews.title: All Foodies Should Go At Least Once!
text: This was my first time going to Taste of the Danforth and I will admit I was a little nervous to go by myself. I had heard about the crazy crowds but thankfully after surviving Italian Fest in Vancouver on Commercial Drive, this was not that bad. In fact I was quite comfortable most of the time.

I never discovered where you can smash plates (look that stuff up ahead of time, I saw no map or signs for anything) but did see quite a few performers on my walk along The Danforth between Broadview and Pape.
I was surprised at how many sport displays, games and contests there were. What did not surprise me were the very long lines to play them. Most of the lines for food were not terribly long.
I only came across one booth giving out free samples of food (Galbani‘s fresh mozzarella skewers) and I purchased the all-time-messiest beef and lamb gyro of my life. Which tasted fantastic!

I saw all lots of people walking around with these carved mangoes on a stick which looked fascinating. When I saw them in this display case I made a beeline to check it out. Then I discovered they cover it with hot sauce!

For me the best part of the event was not knowing what to expect next. First I saw a bride on the way to her wedding, then a guy dressed up as a cob of corn and music was performed on two stages. The energy of the day I went was great, the weather was fantastic and the food delicious. I am so glad I finally got to experience Taste of the Danforth.
~ Suzie the Foodie

reviews.title: BEWARE of Parking Violations! Ticketing Officers LOVE this area! You Cannot Add Times with Two Separate Parking Passes!
text: I came here on a Thursday late afternoon. I came to check out the H20 spa. I parked in a spot at seemed good and paid at a parking pay station. When I reached the spa, there wasn't any spots available, so I went back to my car and I received a parking ticket for 'highway stop sign violation.' I was only gone for 10 minutes and I got a $60 parking ticket! The thing that annoyed me is that after I parked, I talked to the ticket violation officer who was giving tickets to the cars behind me and asked him if I was able to add tickets. I realized that I didn't pay enough time using a credit card for the first parking pass, so I paid change for another parking pass. He informed me that that was not allowed and that they only go by the lastest time on the parking pass, which is absolutely outrageous! It's more like the ticket officers doesn't want to add times together because that would mean more work for them. It's easier to give a parking ticet, so that they can get paid. Ugh! Anyways, on my way back to my car, I passed by the officer and smiled at him (he 'pretended' to not notice me). And when I got back to my car, I can see why! There was a stop sign with a cross on it. So, it means no stopping. But there was no 'No Parking' sign, so I thought that parking would have been fine! Toronto should really be better at making understandable signs! And $60 for a parking ticket is disgusting! Anyways, I learned my lesson so the week after when I booked a spa appointment ahead of time, I parked at a parking lot beside Shoppers Drug Mart for $4 per hour (which is absolutely ridiculous!) It was cheaper at $3 per hour for on street parking, but for some reason parking wasn't allowed on the street between 4 and 6pm. What a cash grab! Anyways, I came here for a spa appointment at H20 Spa. Before and after my appointment, I was able to walk around a bit. There's the Danforth Music Hall, which has famous indie acts play regularly. There's also restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacies and LCBO. Taste of Danforth, which is this coming weekend, will be packed! From a beauty viewpoint, there's not much to see. Just a regular neighbourhood...

reviews.title: I definitely visit here again!
text: I feel that am at home cos hospitalty,kindness,the people who service the delicious meals,local beers..A lot of thanks! :)

reviews.title: Lunch
text: This address does not accurately describe Greektown, you need to go further west to catch the restaurants and bars of Greektown.  Great place for adults and kids.

reviews.title: Lots of Greek restaurants & unique little shops
text: Periodically I’ve had business meetings in the area, and a few times have come to celebrate the mid-August weekend “Taste of the Danforth” festival of tasty Greek foods, games, live entertainment, street performers, stands at which vendors are selling many types inexpensive goods and services, and more. On this visit we came for lunch, followed by an ice-cream dessert, and strolling on the Danforth, window shopping and buying to gifts.

In addition to Greek restaurants in Greektown, there are many others, including those offering Italian, Chinese, Thai, Indian, Japanese, Irish, and other cuisines, cafes, pubs, pizza shops, ice cream shops, and other fast foods.

From an architecture standpoint, there is little to see. There are few buildings over 125 years old. Lots of the restaurants offer outdoor seating. The area tends to be very safe to walk around in, both during the day and evening.
A lot of people walk their dogs in the area.

reviews.title: Nice atmosphere
text: This area is having a vibrant and nice atmosphere.  Here the people are joking and talking sometimes louder, the food is tasty and the places to eat are plenty.

reviews.title: A bit of Greece on the Danforth
text: Considering how long it took me to get here by subway I was somewhat disappointed with Greektown. I was expecting more authentic Greek bakeries, shops, and restaurants, a feeling of a mini Greece. Not all businesses around here are Greek. My boyfriend and I walked into what we thought was a Greek bakery and were disappointed with the taste of the baklava. Greektown on the Danforth isn't as good as it was years back but I'm glad my boyfriend and I got to visit the neighborhood.

reviews.title: LENTIL SOUP, OUZO AND PLEASANT PEOPLE
text: An arch  welcomes you when you enter this section of the street and another one thanks you for the visit at the end of the Greek village which is in reality a southern european and middleeastern world. Interesting shops and restaurants and bars. Do not miss it if you can.Not far from the financial district and Bloor street

reviews.title: Nice restaurants
text: Greektown on the Danforth is no the same anymore .Many Greek restaurants are gone and replaced by other international cuisines.You can still find good Greek food here and the Greek festival in the summer is great place to be and feel like a Greek

reviews.title: A Night On the Town
text: Pleasant sidewalk patios, plenty of people for people watching and good greek-inspired food make this a highly popular destination. You can exit Chester subway station for it's heart, or use Broadview at one end or Pape at it's other to walk the length of it. Oddly, any restaurant here that calls itself greek has just about the same menu (chicken or pork skewers, and rice with potatoes ; ) but they're all decent grilled food, and most have a good ambiance, vibe and character. Ellas (on Pape)  is the oldest, and Astoria (danforth) is up there too. Opa!

reviews.title: Surprisingly Pleasant
text: I went out with a friend to help a Church feeding program for the homeless int his area. After finishing what we had to do, we looked for a cozy restaurant and we found ourselves seated at the front window table. We enjoyed so Greek food and wine and you pay less than in other places in the city for excellent food and service. The area is also pleasant to walk about as one feels, one is somewhere on a trip.

reviews.title: Accessible by Public Transport.
text: Great greek  food, several restaurants, now there are also coffee shops and cheese store, also fruits and vegetable stores.

reviews.title: Multicultural
text: What an array of good restaurants from Greek to Asian to Tibetan to Ethiopian. Great little grocery stores.

reviews.title: opa
text: Its a nice area in midtown just east of the city to go for a classic greek dinner. A number of greek restaurants to choose from, not to mention from other nations also. Not that big of an area, but during the summer they close the street danforth and people can walk the street and sample the food outside of the restaurant. A very popular weekend in the city

reviews.title: Love Greek Food
text: An here are the best places to enjoy Greece without leaving Toronto. So much variety and  tastes. My escape every time I can...

reviews.title: Visiting Relatives in Toronto Greektown
text: My granddaughter has live here for  few years and really loves it.  On my visit we had our choice of what ethnic food we wanted to try.  We have been to a few different restaurants and found all to be inviting and the food has been just want we wanted in each different restaurant.  Where else can you got to taste the foods of the world? All in your own backyard.

reviews.title: Such a GREAT Neighbourhood
text: The Danforth is a fun place to spend an afternoon.  Explore the fun shops, eat the great food, take in a bit of Greek culture. It is both lovely and vibrant.

reviews.title: Greektown: now a mix of Chinese groceries and Great Ethiopian food.
text: On a rainy October day, it is still worth strolling down the Danforth. There is a nice clustering of Ethiopian restaurants as well as Places to get kebabs.

reviews.title: Place to remember
text: Greektown on the Danforth is welcoming and inviting. You can find all the desires of your dreams in this place. Foods, clothing, wines, cheeses, and much more. It is full of adventures. In the summer, it is alive with music and Taste of the Danforth. You have to see it to believe it. I thoroughly enjoy walking on the Danforth and tasting and smelling the foods as well as seeing the sights and listening to the sounds. Please visit and enjoy the sights and sounds of the Danforht,

reviews.title: Many Greek restaurants
text: Many traditional Greek restaurants, as well as various others. Visited many times since we are living nearby.

reviews.title: Eating on the set of My Big Fat Greek Wedding
text: If you want to see a Greek travel agent, shop at a Greek wedding dress store or eat Greek then this is the place to come.

There is a healthy mix of good food places like The Big Carrot but why you come here is to eat at a real Greek restaurant. There are fewer than there was a few years ago as the Greek family owners of the restaurants run out of descendants willing to take over the business. Nowadays chefs of every culture head up the kitchens but they try hard to maintain the hardy Greek eating traditions of souvlaki and grilled lamb and accompanied by the obligatory two starches of potatoes AND rice. The subway gets you here and drops you off at three stations along the Greektown section of the Danforth.

reviews.title: Greek town
text: Being greek you know which restaurants to hit for the best greek food on the danforth strip. Lots to do and see. For a great time with friends hang out on the danforth in greektown.

reviews.title: Nice place to stroll
text: Have lived near the Danforth for a couple of dozen years and while restaurants and stores change (some for the better and some not) the vibe remains one of an easy-going and diverse neighbourhood.

reviews.title: Best.. hasn’t changed in 20 years
text: Wow, last time I was there was 15 years ago and nothing has changed. Great good, fair prices and large portions.
Nothing fancy, just all about the food.

reviews.title: Memorable Street Food Festival
text: Have been going to the Greek Food Festival at Danforth for the last 7 years. Lots of choice of Greek food, samplers, and music at a few spots. As the area is spread from Broadview to Jones Ave, will not feel much of a crowd although it is very crowded. Best opportunity to taste different types of Greek foods that otherwise would not be possible. One of my favorites.

reviews.title: Great foods at Taste of the Danforth
text: Fun music and lots of food options offered at the stalls set up on the road and the local restaurants. After waiting in line for about 15 minutes, I had a skewer of pork souvlaki, with extra Tzatziki  and salad.

reviews.title: OMG Taste of the Danforth this weekend
text: If you are visiting Toronto this weekend you should really experience this Greek experience. The Lamb Chops from Ellas Meat Market at Pape Ave. are heavenly. Souvlaki delicious as well. Rides and games for children. Music, free samples, music .What a great experience.

reviews.title: Friendly Vibe with Great Food and Shopping!
text: I may be a bit partial as I'm Greek, but I've been to my share of Greektowns across the country and they are not all equal. Toronto's Greektown has some of the best authentic Greek food around and plenty of shops to browse in with lots of beautiful items. It was hard not to feel the warmth and pride these vendors have in their heritage. Oh the pastries...way too many yummy, sweet and fluffy ones to choose from. I always take a box of mixed goodies to bring home, but I tend to eat them all on the ride home. You can tell the vibe of a place by watching the visitors and the visitors of the Toronto Greektown were all smiles.  Greeks are friendly folks who know how to take care of their guests.

reviews.title: Pleasant stroll nice boutiques lively place
text: Nice walking and looking at the shopwindow. Interesting bars and restaurants with tables on the sidewalk (in season) .
I like walking alone or with my grandchildren and always find something interesting to discover. Shopwindow you may feel like being in a metropolis somewhere in a European city.
